tweets.text: We‚Äôve been restoring the River Camel near Bodmin - removing artificial structures from the river, improving fish passage and enhancing floodplain habitat. Grogley Weir has been removed, and we‚Äôve been adding woody material to the river to improve the habitat.#WorldRiversDay https://t.co/E4RZJhFrEi

@FreshwaterIzzy @BensonNature @hlj501 @bensonbirdman @ValSiddiqui Yes, from the brook aka Ewelme Stream. It‚Äôs higher than Sep 19 but the same reading as April 19. @bensonbirdman took more samples around #Cressbeds - also high up there. tweets.text: @EnvAgency #WorldRiversDay extraordinary to claim the rivers are improving & polluters are prosecuted under your management @JamesBevanEA @EmmaHowardBoyd this is the true picture of the state of the rivers 2018 Gaywood river tributary once a lovely Chalkstream üí©üíÄüêüüò± https://t.co/jIsanf5EbA

@EnvAgency You don‚Äôt say what your response is? Is it just noting it down? Because every single river for which you have responsibility failed pollution tests. Every single one. Whatever your response is, it‚Äôs clearly wholly inadequate.

@EnvAgency If you were effective we wouldn't be in a position where every single river in the country has failed to meet the required cleanliness standard. Stop bigging yourselves up, and do the damned job.
@EnvAgency No you don't. The evidence puts your incompetence under the spotlight. Stop sending out propaganda and start prosecuting the offenders. Get some teeth.

@EdenRiversTrust @EnvAgencyNW @networkrail @AquaUoS Fantastic! I visited a similar section of realigned channel at Thrimby with you guys and @EnvAgency FBG colleagues in Sept 2016. Where is this section in relation to that? https://t.co/EzJwzUKfUe
@EnvAgency This is the biggest load of cobblers you have ever come up with.  The EA has presided over the greatest decline in the quality of rivers for a century.  You should be ashamed of yourselves

@EnvAgency i am sure that you have made a difference in some areas. i reported continuing pollution about a month ago to a stream in lancashire. i took a sample of the oily deposits. i have had no follow up, no visit, no call. is there any point reporting pollution?

Rivers are vital to our environment. We respond to an environmental incident every 45 minutes to stop and reverse damage to our rivers. 
 
Let's work together to protect them. 
 
#WorldRiversDay https://t.co/0d3EzXd2ic

The changes to the sewage discharge permits in 2010 came via an appeal by @thameswater to the Planning Inspectorate. Shame on Thames for asking for them, shame on the Planning Inspectorate for upholding the appeal and shame on the @EnvAgency for accepting them without a whimper. https://t.co/kGu99tFYl4

@picturespete @EnvAgency As we now know ever single river, ever single river in England is polluted.

And the @EnvAgency do what exactly?

Our beautiful rivers are in crisis. Recent @EnvAgency data showed none of England's rivers are in good overall health üò®
We're grateful to all our volunteers who dedicate time to helping our rivers, but we need more govt. regulation to combat this crisis #WorldRiversDay üëä https://t.co/6MZ0vxjiXq
@ali_gooner @19rodders71 @WildTroutTrust Oh don't worry about my sensitivities. Pay up. üòú

For @Feargal_Sharkey , no surprises here? Nitrate and Phosphate levels in Rivers Ver and Colne show river conditions as moderate or poor... not the ‚Äògood‚Äô the @EnvAgency predicted from 2015. Oh well... #chalkstream https://t.co/XtWGJusulB
@LewisGraydon88 @EnvAgency @JamesBevanEA i know some that work on the ground at the ea and they are great people and work hard and equally frustrated, the problem is at the top.

urls.title: Home - Wildlife Ways
urls.description: Wildlife Ways is a ¬£16.8 million programme, part-funded by the European Regional Development Fund (ERDF), to improve Solihull borough for the benefit of people and wildlife. It will include tree, bulb and wildflower planting and make it easier for people wanting to walk and cycle by widening and connecting paths and cycle routes with green spaces.

annotations.normalized_text: 650m of Kingshurst Brook in Chelmsley Wood

tweets.text: Project to re-naturalise 650m of Kingshurst Brook in Chelmsley Wood on track. Narrowed channel = increased water velocity = cleansed gravel bed (4th photo) Funded by EA and ERDF https://t.co/sdweOZi0gu @EnvAgencyMids @EnvAgency @Team4Nature @WKWT @LoveSolihull @SolihullUpdates https://t.co/ha4cVG5rc7
